intro: Heracleum lanatum var. asiaticum, commonly known as the Asian cow parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, fern-like compound leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are small, greenish-white umbels that appear in late spring to early summer. This plant is often found in moist, open habitats and can be invasive in some regions.
